definition: bone china (fine white porcelain made from a mixture of clay and bone ash)

sentences.english: The product has the features of translucent, exquisite, pure white and gorgeous.
sentences.chinese: 具有高档骨瓷的通透，细腻，白洁，华丽品性。

sentences.english: The so-called bone china, was invented by the British in 1794.
sentences.chinese: 所谓骨瓷，是于1794年由英国人发明的。

sentences.english: At present, bone china is also the owner of the identity and status symbol.
sentences.chinese: 就在如今，骨瓷也是主人身份与地位的象征。

sentences.english: She sat sip ping gin from a bone china cup.
sentences.chinese: 她坐着嗫饮骨瓷杯中的杜松子酒。

sentences.english: New bone China and fine ceramic, five broad headings.
In now, the bone porcelain be also the symbol of the mastership and position.
sentences.chinese: 就在如今，骨瓷也是主人身份与地位的象征。

sentences.english: At present, bone china is the master identity and status symbol.
sentences.chinese: 就在如今，骨瓷也是主人身份与地位的象征。

sentences.english: Bone China compare to those of today's respected high-end fashion tableware.
sentences.chinese: 骨瓷是当今时尚人士比较推崇的高档餐具。

sentences.english: The wedding memorabilia is being made with bone china.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼纪念品是用骨瓷制成的。

sentences.english: Bone china porcelain is basically made by adding bone ash to kaolin and petuntse.
sentences.chinese: 骨瓷的基本成分是加入骨粉的高岭土和白墩子。
